%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%% Textclass specific LaTeX commands.
 % this default might be overridden by plain title style
 \newcommand\makebeamertitle{\frame{\maketitle}}%
 \AtBeginDocument{
   \let\origtableofcontents=\tableofcontents
   \def\tableofcontents{\@ifnextchar[{\origtableofcontents}{\gobbletableofcontents}}
   \def\gobbletableofcontents#1{\origtableofcontents}
 }
 \long\def\lyxframe#1{\@lyxframe#1\@lyxframestop}%
 \def\@lyxframe{\@ifnextchar<{\@@lyxframe}{\@@lyxframe<*>}}%
 \def\@@lyxframe<#1>{\@ifnextchar[{\@@@lyxframe<#1>}{\@@@lyxframe<#1>[]}}
 \def\@@@lyxframe<#1>[{\@ifnextchar<{\@@@@@lyxframe<#1>[}{\@@@@lyxframe<#1>[<*>][}}
 \def\@@@@@lyxframe<#1>[#2]{\@ifnextchar[{\@@@@lyxframe<#1>[#2]}{\@@@@lyxframe<#1>[#2][]}}
 \long\def\@@@@lyxframe<#1>[#2][#3]#4\@lyxframestop#5\lyxframeend{%
   \frame<#1>[#2][#3]{\frametitle{#4}#5}}
 \def\lyxframeend{} % In case there is a superfluous frame end

%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%% User specified LaTeX commands.
\usetheme{Copenhagen}

\makeatother

\begin{document}

\title{Let's Git With It}


\author{Andrew Borgman}


\institute{Van Andel Research Institute}

\makebeamertitle

\lyxframeend{}\lyxframe{Overview}
\begin{enumerate}
\item Git Comfortable
\item Journal Club Business

\begin{enumerate}
\item A few slides covering the basics
\end{enumerate}
\item Xenophobia Musings

\begin{enumerate}
\item What did you think?
\item Could we do it?
\item Would it be worth it?
\item I think so.
\end{enumerate}
\end{enumerate}

\lyxframeend{}


\lyxframeend{}\lyxframe{Journal Club}

\begin{center}
\includegraphics[scale=0.16]{images/abstract-resize}
\par\end{center}


\lyxframeend{}


\lyxframeend{}\lyxframe{Journal Club}

\begin{center}
\includegraphics[scale=0.16]{images/abstract-resize-combine}
\par\end{center}


\lyxframeend{}


\lyxframeend{}\lyxframe{Important Themes}
\begin{itemize}
\item Open Science Initiatives

\begin{itemize}
\item ``Reproducibility is the hallmark of good science.''
\item Journals requiring data and analysis code be shared
\item Science needs to be community based to be successful

\begin{itemize}
\item How do I solve a programming problem: Stack Overflow
\item How do I solve a bioinformatics problem: SEQanswers
\item How do I solve a statistics problem: CrossValidated
\end{itemize}
\item Share your ideas and code!
\end{itemize}
\item Git Can Help Facilitate Open Science

\begin{itemize}
\item Enables reproducibility
\item Provides rigorous tracking of projects
\item GitHub provides community and great hosting
\item BitBucket might be better (https://bitbucket.org/)
\end{itemize}
\end{itemize}

\lyxframeend{}


\lyxframeend{}\lyxframe{Uses Of Git In Science}
\begin{enumerate}
\item Lab notebook
\item Facilitating collaboration
\item Backup and failsafe against data loss
\item Freedom to explore new ideas and methods
\item Mechanism to solicit feedback and reviews
\item Increase transparency and verifiability
\item Managing large data
\item Lowering barriers to reuse
\end{enumerate}

\lyxframeend{}


\lyxframeend{}\lyxframe{Why Should We Do It?}
\begin{itemize}
\item Provides high level of integrity in analysis

\begin{itemize}
\item Results can always be reproduced by typing 'make'
\item All figures and tables created directly from data
\item Everything is tracked; no more uncertainty
\end{itemize}
\item Should be providing ``publication quality analysis''

\begin{itemize}
\item Our duty as a core service to VARI investigators
\item Publications are asking for data and code; have it ready
\end{itemize}
\item We need more structure

\begin{itemize}
\item Current structure is OK, but it is not effective for code sharing
\item Still can't step in a project dir and know what is going on
\item I think Git/Make approach would help 
\end{itemize}
\end{itemize}

\lyxframeend{}


\lyxframeend{}\lyxframe{How Should We Do It -- Logistics}
\begin{itemize}
\item Up for debate
\item Use a public hosting site?

\begin{itemize}
\item Initially thought GitHub would be best

\begin{itemize}
\item Can pay small monthly fee to have private repos 
\end{itemize}
\item BitBucket allows for unlimited private repos

\begin{itemize}
\item Pay for \# of users 
\item Free for 5, \$10/mo for 10
\item This might be the way to go for us
\end{itemize}
\item BitBucket example: \href{https://bitbucket.org/borgmaan/xenophobia/overview}{https://bitbucket.org/borgmaan/xenophobia/overview}
\end{itemize}
\item Host it ourselves?

\begin{itemize}
\item This might get too hairy
\item Would let us store and track \textbf{all} data though
\end{itemize}
\end{itemize}

\lyxframeend{}


\lyxframeend{}\lyxframe{How Should We Do It -- Day-to-Day}
\begin{itemize}
\item Keep it simple to allow for quick integration
\item Master standard workflow

\begin{itemize}
\item Create, add, push, pull
\end{itemize}
\item Only need a few commands

\begin{itemize}
\item init, add, commit, push pulll
\end{itemize}
\item Can follow my structure 

\begin{itemize}
\item Use R to create all images and tables (\TeX{}) directly from your
data 
\item Use \LyX{} for a MS Word substitute for report creation 
\item Export \LaTeX{} source from \LyX{} file 
\item Create Makefile that runs your R code, creates your figures, then
compiles your report using pdflatex or something like that
\item http://kbroman.github.io/minimal\_make/ :: Like this! 
\end{itemize}
\end{itemize}

\lyxframeend{}


\lyxframeend{}\lyxframe{Questions?}
\begin{quote}%{}
On to a demo @ \href{https://github.com/borgmaan/xenophobia}{https://github.com/borgmaan/xenophobia}!
\end{quote}%{}

\lyxframeend{}
\end{document}
